name: py-simplejson
description: Simplejson is a simple, fast, extensible JSON encoder/decoder for Python

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependent_to.name: py-avro-json-serializer
dependent_to.description: Serializes data into a JSON format using AVRO schema.

dependent_to.name: py-fava
dependent_to.description:
Fava is a web interface for the double-entry bookkeeping software
Beancount with a focus on features and usability.

dependent_to.name: py-mikado
dependent_to.description:
Mikado is a lightweight Python3 pipeline whose purpose is to facilitate
the identification of expressed loci from RNA-Seq data * and to select
the best models in each locus.

dependent_to.name: py-csvkit
dependent_to.description:
A library of utilities for working with CSV, the king of tabular file
formats

dependent_to.name: py-nipype
dependent_to.description: Neuroimaging in Python: Pipelines and Interfaces.

dependent_to.name: py-datalad
dependent_to.description:
data distribution geared toward scientific datasets. DataLad makes data
management and data distribution more accessible. To do that, it stands
on the shoulders of Git and Git-annex to deliver a decentralized system
for data exchange. This includes automated ingestion of data from online
portals and exposing it in readily usable form as Git(-annex)
repositories, so-called datasets. The actual data storage and permission
management, however, remains with the original data providers.

dependent_to.name: py-gffutils
dependent_to.description:
GFF and GTF file manipulation and interconversion gffutils is a Python
package for working with and manipulating the GFF and GTF format files
typically used for genomic annotations. Files are loaded into a sqlite3
database, allowing much more complex manipulation of hierarchical
features (e.g., genes, transcripts, and exons) than is possible with
plain-text methods alone.

dependent_to.name: py-multiqc
dependent_to.description:
MultiQC is a tool to aggregate bioinformatics results across many
samples into a single report. It is written in Python and contains
modules for a large number of common bioinformatics tools.
